page.title: 17POULTRY FARMING
page.content: At Lower Crundelend Farm poultry is produced for the meat market.The birds are bought in as day old poults or chicks and fattened for the table. Turkeys range in size from 10-40lb. and broiler chickens up to 6lb.approx: In a twelve month period they rear approx: 40,000 turkeys and 750,000 chickens which are kept in over 128,000 sq.ft.of housing.They are sold either through wholesalers or to individual butchers.All chickens go alive but 85% of the turkeys they kill themselves.Catering birds are sold from April onwards and 50% of these go ready dressed.There are 8 regular staff but the busiest time is prior to Christmas when 40 extra staff are taken on for plucking the 20,000 birds sold.Although the birds are fed automatically some days begin at 4a.m. and staff work long hours at times.
